subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Fine-Tuning: Is the Universe Made for Us?
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Fine-Tuning: Is the Universe Made for Us?.

hook.text: Change one physical constant by a fraction and no stars, no planets, no life. The universe seems impossibly fine-tuned.

buildup.text: The gravitational constant, the strong nuclear force, and the cosmological constant must be exactly what they are.

discovery.text: If gravity were slightly stronger, the universe collapses. Slightly weaker, no stars form. The margin is razor-thin.

twist.text: Atheists invoke the multiverse: infinite universes, and we happen to be in the right one. Believers say: God tuned it.

climax.text: Fine-tuning is the strongest argument for design. It's also the strongest test case for creative naturalistic answers.

punchline.text: The universe seems fine-tuned for life. God or luck? Science can't decide.

quiz.question: What is the fine-tuning argument?
options: The observation that physical constants seem precisely set for life to exist
